intro: Cnidium affine, commonly known as the lesser cnidium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach a height of up to 60 centimeters. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties. Cnidium affine is also valued for its aromatic qualities and is sometimes cultivated as a ornamental plant.
